For the ones who asked which converter , You dont use a converter for the Lossless rips , you need to do it in a Professional video editing software , Plus you should have a video card (not Graphics card) like Canopus or Ati FirePro GL , depending on your budget . That will give you realtime video conversion , input and output. You can guess the rest. I use Avid Liquid 7 Pro , You can buy the soft and the Avid video card that comes in a combo package for some 4K $ , (in my country) .

Sorry for my last comment , been 3 years since I bought my Avid Liquid , the price has greatly dropped to 999$ for the pro pack and the 499 for the standard pack ... Get the details here .. http://library.creativecow.net/articles/harvey_mark/avid_liquid_7_review.php

There are a lot of Pro Realtime Video Card with Softwares out there, it depends on you according to your work, I wouldnt recommend buying such stuff for Just Ripping movies unless you got enough money for entertainment purposes.

There are other places where you can get BR Rips at the size of 150mb+ , similar quality , But I dont intend to post the links or names here or spoil RiddlerA's work, you can google yourself if you want
